titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Archives of Irish America Collection on The Quiet Man AIA.042
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:51:06 -0400.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Archives of Irish America Collection on The Quiet Man

physdesc.extent: in 3 film canisters, 1 oversize folder, and 2 oversize posters.

did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two days prior to research visit.
did.abstract: The materials in this collection were collected and assembled by the staff of the Archives of Irish America and various donors in an attempt to document ethnic and cultural aspects of the 1952 John Ford film, The Quiet Man. The collection includes an original 35mm print and an oversized theater poster of the film.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Archives of Irish America Collection on The Quiet Man; AIA 042; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of the materials in this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with the materials is 1997.033.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection are held by the creator. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which s/he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: A DVD version of the film is available in the Avery Fisher Center for Music and Media: DVD 9699.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of memorabilia related to John Ford's 1952 film The Quiet Man. The collection includes an original 35mm print, an oversized theater poster of the film, and movie posters.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The materials in this collection were collected and assembled by the staff of the Archives of Irish America and various donors in an attempt to document ethnic and cultural aspects of the 1952 John Ford film, The Quiet Man.
